answers.answer: If this "tic" you describe is making you sort of seize up, then you may have a form of Tourette's Syndrome.  It expresses itself differently in diff people, but some of those folks do not want to touch anything or they'll get that body jerking thing happening.  Sometimes skin sensitivity comes from other problems, like peripheral neuropathy, or glandular imbalance, or even diabetes.  To narrow it down, you need a general doc to draw blood and check your thyroid, adrenals, sugar numbers, vitamin levels, and also to do a basic neurological office exam that includes watching you walk and checking the way your eyes track, and they should also know what Tourette's looks like.  Then they can refer you to the right specialist to do some more tests and figure you out.
